Company: Progressive Casualty Insurance Co. and Progressive Garden State Insurance Co.
Description: Two insurance companies that are part of one of the largest providers of automobile insurance in the United States agreed to pay more than $2 million to resolve allegations that they violated the False Claims Act by causing Medicare and Medicaid to pay for claims for which the companies were responsible.

Description: Progressive Direct agreed to pay $120,000 and reimburse consumers in settlement of allegations it provided inaccurate quotes on its rate comparison website.

Progressive agreed to pay $87,500 in restitution, $10,000 in costs and $30,000 to the State in settlement of allegations that an Iowa branch office obtained ownership of damaged vehicles and resold them without the required salvage title, which significantly reduces the value of a vehicle.
